definition: not stint/not spare/not hesitate (to do sth)/not scruple (to do sth)
(negative prefix)/not/no
to cherish/to begrudge/to pity/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
to be ready to go to war
to spare no effort/to devote all one's energies

sentences.english: Our factory has spared no cost to manufacture artificial limBs in order to serve disaBled people.
sentences.chinese: 本厂不惜工本制造假肢，为残疾人服务。

sentences.english: The general swore to take back this island whatever the cost.
sentences.chinese: 我位将军发誓不惜任何代价夺回这个岛。

sentences.english: In order to monopolize power, he does not hesitate to use every mean trick.
sentences.chinese: 为了能够掌权，他不惜使用各种卑劣手段。

sentences.english: Then there are the few brae souls who grab at its horns and hang on at all costs.
sentences.chinese: 只有极少数的灵魂不畏艰险，不惜一切。

sentences.english: This is both contagious and deadly and must be avoided at all costs.
sentences.chinese: 这会传染且是致命的，必须不惜一切代价加以避免。

sentences.english: He spared no expense in building a villa for himself.
sentences.chinese: 他不惜工本为自己造了一幢别墅。

sentences.english: With a lack of IMAX theaters, people are traveling long distances to see the movie.
sentences.chinese: 由于IMAX影院稀缺，人们不惜长途跋涉。

sentences.english: ChengJun and RenHui to can withdraw a kernel really at risk shares.
sentences.chinese: 成俊和仁惠为了可以收回仁真建立的股份不惜冒险。

sentences.english: Avoid negative cash flow at all cost.
sentences.chinese: 不惜一切代价避免负的现金流。

sentences.english: I’m willing to go to thermonuclear war on this.
sentences.chinese: 对此，我不惜发动核战争。

sentences.english: They decorated the house regardless of cost.
sentences.chinese: 他不惜一切成本装修他的房子。

sentences.english: She desires to succeed in business, at any cost.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望在商业上成功，不惜任何代价。

sentences.english: Rewards, more public pressure, inspiration, whatever it takes.
sentences.chinese: 奖赏，更多的公众压力，鼓舞，不惜代价。

sentences.english: Do your job well, and avoid confrontations at all costs.
sentences.chinese: 把你的工作做好，不惜任何代价避免正面冲突。

sentences.english: Megatron must be stoped, no matter the cost.
sentences.chinese: 必须不惜一切代价阻止威震天。

sentences.english: We are so insatiably curious that we gather data even if it gets us in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我们如此好奇地搜集信息以致卷入麻烦也在所不惜。

definition: to spare no effort/to devote all one's energies
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
committing all manner of crimes/completely unscrupulous
pinyin: wu2 suo3 bu4 yong4 qi2 ji2

definition: to cherish/to begrudge/to pity/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
willingly
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
by fair means or foul/by hook or by crook/unscrupulously
to think up every possible method (idiom); to devise ways and means/to try this, that and the other
reckless/regardless of everything
in order to/for the purpose of/so as to
in spite of/regardless of
lit. thousand ways, a hundred plans (idiom); by every possible means
to take a lot of trouble (idiom); painstaking/at the cost of a lot of effort
would rather.../it would be better.../would prefer
would rather/better
to force/to compel/to coerce
